summary: This document is a daily log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 2, 2019, detailing inmate movements, status changes, and releases. It is significant as it shows the facility's operations on the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell, though his name is not listed in this extracted segment.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Inmate Movements
events.description: A log of routine inmate movements, status changes (ADM CHANGE, HLD REMOVE), releases (GCT REL, RELEASE, BAIL/BOND), and cell transfers at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York (implied by NYMFC/NYM codes)
keyFacts: This is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) daily facility log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for August 2, 2019.
The log details routine inmate management actions including admissions changes, hold removals, releases, and cell transfers for over 30 inmates.
Jeffrey Epstein, who died in his MCC New York cell on August 10, 2019, is not listed among the inmates in this specific log extract from August 2.
The document is part of the SENTRY prison management system, indicating standard correctional facility record-keeping.
The log shows the facility was operational with multiple inmate movements and administrative actions on this date.
